section.title: Introduction
section.para:
RPM installation consists of the following steps:
Downloading the &sr; RPM distribution and &sr;'s sample data sets.
Installing &sr; using the rpm command.
Installing &sr;'s sample data sets.
Installing &sr;'s documentation.

section.title: Downloading
section.para:
From SCI's software archive page download the following files:
&sr;-x.x.x-mdk9.0.i586.rpm for Mandrake 9 systems, or &sr;-x.x.x-rh8.0.i386.rpm for Redhat 8 systems.
DataSets.x.x.x.tar.gz
docs.x.x.x.tar.gz

section.title: Installing
section.para:
Open a shell terminal (e.g. xterm) and enter the command su to become the root user (superuser). The su command will prompt for root's password:
rpm -ivh &sr;-x.x.x-mdk9.0.i586.rpm
for Mandrake 9 systems and
rpm -ivh &sr;-x.x.x-rh8.0.i386.rpm
for Red Hat 8 systems. The RPM should take approximately one minute to install.
Type exit to leave the root account.

section.title: &sr;'s Sample Data Sets
section.para: Install the sample data sets into /usr/local. You must have root privileges.

Become root:
su -
and type:
gunzip -c DataSets.x.x.x.tar.gz | (cd /usr/local && tar xf -)
This will create /usr/local/&sr;Data, the sample data sets directory. Type exit to leave the root account.

section.title: &sr;'s Documentation
section.para: The following procedure installs the documentation in the directory /usr/local

Use the su command to become the root user. Then Cd to the directory containing the compressed documentation tarball and type:
gunzip -c docs.x.x.x.tar.gz | (cd /usr/local && tar xf -)
This will create /usr/local/&sr;Docs, the &sr; documentation directory. Type exit to leave the root account.
Point a browser at /usr/local/&sr;Docs/doc/index.html to view &sr;'s online documentation.
